alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 4:30PM EDT until August 07 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Franklin County in northeastern Georgia... Stephens County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Habersham County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 429 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles northwest of Homer, or near Alto, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto, Martin, Avalon and Raoul. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
